required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Automated Breast Ultrasound and Digital Breast Tomosynthesis Screening Compared to Full Field Digital Mammography in Women With Dense Breasts
clinical_study.official_title: Automated Breast Ultrasound and Digital Breast Tomosynthesis Screening Compared to Full Field Digital Mammography in Women With Dense Breasts

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This study is investigating whether automated whole breast ultrasound can improve detection of cancer in breast cancer screening when used as a supplement to mammography or as a supplement to digital breast tomosynthesis

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: Abnormal interpretation rates for each modality (FFDM and DBT+V-Preview, with and without ABUS+V-Preview).

secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity will be assessed for each imaging modality: FFDM and DBT+V-Preview, with and without ABUS
Specificity will be assessed for each imaging modality: FFDM and DBT+V-Preview, with and without ABUS
Cancer Rate will be assessed for each imaging modality: FFDM and DBT+V-Preview, with and without ABUS
Positive Predictive Value will be assessed for each imaging modality: FFDM and DBT+V-Preview, with and without ABUS
Negative Predictive Value will be assessed for each imaging modality: FFDM and DBT+V-Preview, with and without ABUS

arm_group.description: Subjects enrolled in this group will receive a full field digital mammogram, digital breast tomosynthesis exam and an automated whole breast ultrasound exam as part of their visit.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects will be selected from the patients arriving at the clinic for yearly breast cancer screening exams

facility.name: University of Washington Seattle Cancer Care Alliance
